metadata.title: CVE-2021-29495 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
Nim is a statically typed compiled systems programming language. In Nimstandard library before 1.4.2, httpClient SSL/TLS certificate verificationwas disabled by default. Users can upgrade to version 1.4.2 to receive apatch or, as a workaround, set "verifyMode = CVerifyPeer" as documented.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-29495` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

nim - 1.6.10-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nim package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.6.10-2').
